pages.text: On a day like any other, I had the first idea to bring the Tarot cards to our blocky multiverse.$(br)  I looked briefly into it and was surprised at the lack of options, after all, there are mods and packs for almost everything under the sun.$(br)  Searching deeper, I found $(o)The Arcade Arcanum$() by Rose, a beautifully pixelated rendition of the Waite-Smith deck, and started envisioning what could be done.$(br)  I worked to adapt the $(o)Arcade

$(o)Arcanum$() deck as a special texture pack for Minecraft and after just a few days I had finished it! But to my dismay,$(br)I was struck with the sheer inconvenience of having to deal with 78 different items that wouldn't fit even in a double chest...$(br)  That is when inspiration for a Tarot mod for Minecraft first struck. I installed MCreator, a Minecraft Mod developing interface, and got to work.$(br)  This book started as simple documentation for the Tarot

mod but soon it bloomed.$(br)  At first my plan was to include a copy of $(o)'The Pictorial Key to the Tarot'$() by A.E. Waite, as I thought It would be an optimal source due to the $(o)Arcade Arcanum$() being heavily inspired by the Waite-Smith deck.$(br)  As I revised the $(o)Pictorial Key$() I found the necessity to adapt much of its outdated language and to 'localize' it to a more Minecraftian context.$(br)  This book may have started like this, but I have since

understood that such a simple adaptation would be a disservice to the tradition of the Tarot, to the study of the Mysteries and to the brilliant Minecraft community.$(br)  So I took it upon myself the task to expand upon Waite's initial work by incorporating information from different authors as well as personal observations.$(br)  $(o)'A Clue to the Tarot'$() morphed into a small chimerical collaboration of works from Éliphas Lévi, Arthur Waite,

Aleister Crowley, Israel Regardie and Rachel Polack, remixed with my own meditative consideration.$(br)  As it stands it serves as a humble introduction to the subject and will also help as a reference in Tarot readings.$(br)  I hope it will also serve as an invitation into further study of the Tarot, Qabalah and other Mystery Traditions for those that can make good use of this knowledge.$(br)  For as much as has been written about the Tarot, much

more will still be written. But aside from words, the Tarot would never be what it is without the talented and inspired work from artists.$(br)  I would like to honor Pamela Colman Smith, Rose and the many other unnamed artists that help keep this tradition alive through their passionate vision and arduous work.$(br)  Just as the Tarot and its emcopassing philosophy have evolved through time, cultures and places with the help of adventurers and visionaires,
may it grow far and wide, into and out the wonderful worlds of Minecraft.$(br2)                      - Nion
